theme.title: Notes tied to a triplet
theme.para: In this lesson a new rhythmic pattern is introduced, by tying a note to a triplet:

score.music: (score (vers 1.6) (instrument (musicData (time 2 4 noVisible)(n * q l)(n * e g+ t3)(n * e)(n * e g- t-)(barline) (n * e g+)(n * e l g-)(n * e g+ t3)(n * e)(n * e g- t-)(barline end) )))

part.title: Listen and take notice of the differences
part.para: Note the difference between the first and the second measure, and between the third and the fourth. Note how they are formed when tying the note to the triplet:

score.music: (score (vers 1.6) (instrument (musicData (clef G)(key C)(time 2 4)(n a4 q)(n a4 e g+ t3)(n a4 e)(n a4 e g- t-)(barline) (n a4 q l)(n a4 e g+ t3)(n a4 e)(n a4 e g- t-)(barline) (n a4 e g+)(n a4 e g-)(n a4 e g+ t3)(n a4 e)(n a4 e g- t-)(barline) (n a4 e g+)(n a4 e l g-)(n a4 e g+ t3)(n a4 e)(n a4 e g- t-)(barline end) )))

part.title: Exercises
part.para: Exercise 1 - Train your ear and practise the introduced rhythmic patterns.
Exercise 2 - Read scores containing the rhythms studied in this lesson.
